intro: Houstonia pulvinata, commonly known as the Carolina springbeauty, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically reaches a height of 5 to 15 centimeters, with hairy stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are clustered at the base of the plant. Houstonia pulvinata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
